intro: Impatiens teitensis subsp. teitensis, commonly known as the Teitan impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the island of Te Iti in French Polynesia. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
